greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = product_{p} - product_{p-1}, where p are distinct primes dividing n; a(n) = A007947(n) - A173557(n).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..16384
example: For n = 45 = 3^2 * 5, the prime factors are 3 and 5, thus a(45) = (3*5) - (2*4) = 15 - 8 = 7.
program: A003557(n) = { my(f=factor(n)); for (i=1, #f~, f[i, 2] = f[i, 2]-1); factorback(f); }; \\ From A003557
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Aug 26 2018
